alert.description: alert: NOSFP:Cannot connect to primary or backup HMC
alert.msg_template: Cannot connect to the the primary nor the backup HMC for reporting serviceable events. (Cannot connect to primary or backup HMC)
alert.recommendation: There is a problem communicating with both the primary and backup HMC for logging network serviceable events. Contact IBM Service and report the alert ID. Check the network connections between the EMS and HMCs. If the network problem cannot be isolated and repaired, contact the next level of support.

alert.description: alert: NONBR:No Neighbor Found
alert.msg_template: ISNM cannot find a neighbor for an event that should have one. (No Neighbor Found)
alert.recommendation: A neighbor was not found for an event that requires one. Contact IBM Service and report the alert ID. Determine the neighbor, and check for events reported by it, because event analysis would not have been able to relate events on the neighbor to this event; this can result in reporting events that are not serviceable.

alert.description: alert: ON_ERROR_LOC:on_error - location
alert.msg_template: ISNM has reported an invalid location to TEAL. (on_error - location)
alert.recommendation: Record the alert ID, and call your next level of support.

alert.recommendation: There is a problem with a hub chip. Record the alert ID. Record the location from the alert message. Contact IBM Service. Replace the FRU according to the FRU list.

alert.recommendation: There is a problem with a hub module. Record the alert ID. Record the location from the alert message. Contact IBM Service. Replace the the local reporting FRU according the FRU list.

alert.description: alert: FAULTY_HUB:Faulty Network Hub

alert.description: alert: FAULTY_LRCABASSY_PARTIAL:Faulty LR-link cable assembly - 48 or more links
alert.msg_template: Faulty LR link cable assembly \in frame $frame cage $cage (superNode $supernode drawer $drawer) affected 48 or more links. (Faulty LR-link cable assembly - 48 or more links)
alert.recommendation: There is a problem with a group of HFI ports associated with an LR Link Assembly. The problem may be with a particular handle in the assembly. Record the alert ID. Record the location from the alert message. Contact IBM Service. Log on to the Management Server. The problem may be resolved by reseating or replacing the LR-link assembly. If there are operational LR-links remaining in the superNode, any service action can be very disruptive to the network. On the EMS, use the lsnwlinkinfo command to query the current state of the LR-links.

alert.description: alert: FAULTY_LRCABASSY:Faulty LR-link cable assembly - full
alert.msg_template: Faulty or removed LR link cable assembly in frame $frame $cage (superNode $supernode drawer $drawer) afftecting 192 links. (Faulty LR-link cable assembly - full)
alert.recommendation: There is a problem with a group of HFI ports associated with an LR Link Assembly. Record the alert ID. Record the location from the alert message. Contact IBM Service. The problem may be resolved by reseating or replacing the LR-link assembly. If there are operational LR-links remaining in the superNode, any service action can be very disruptive to the network. On the EMS, use the lsnwlinkinfo command to query the current state of the LR-links.

alert.description: alert: SUSPECT_DRAWER:Suspicious Drawer
alert.msg_template: Drawer level event occurred on frame $frame cage $cage (superNode $supernode drawer $drawer). (Suspicious Drawer)
alert.recommendation: A large number of HFI network links attached to a drawer are down without an accompanying power event. Contact IBM Service and report the alert ID. If a drawer lost power, then this is a secondary effect.

alert.description: alert: SUSPECT_SUPERNODE:Suspicious SuperNode
alert.msg_template: SuperNode level event occurred on frame $frame superNode $supernode. Multiple drawers in a supernode are impacted. (Suspicious SuperNode)
alert.recommendation: A large number of HFI network links attached to a superNode are down without an accompanying power event. Contact IBM Service and report the alert ID. If a superNode lost power, then this is a secondary effect.

alert.description: alert: SUSPECT_FRAME:Suspicious Frame
alert.msg_template: Frame level event occurred in frame $frame. Multiple CECs are impacted. (Suspicious Frame)
alert.recommendation: A large number of HFI network links in a Frame are down without an accompanying power event. Record the alert ID. Record the location from the alert message. Contact IBM Service. If a frame lost power, then this is a secondary effect.

alert.description: alert: NETWORKFAULT:Network Fault
alert.msg_template: HFI Network Fault (Network Fault)
alert.recommendation: Record the alert ID. Call your next level of support and inform them that there is a general network problem and give them the alert ID.

alert.description: alert: BOUNCINGDLNK:Bouncing D-Link
alert.msg_template: D-link bouncing between frame $frame cage $cage (superNode $supernode drawer $drawer) hub $hub port $nodePort and frame $neighbor_frame cage $neighbor_cage (superNode $neighbor_supernode drawer $neighbor_drawer) hub $neighbor_hub port $neighbor_nodePort (Bouncing D-Link)
alert.recommendation: There is a problem with a D-Link. Record the alert ID. Record the location in the alert message. Contact IBM Service. Log on to the Management Server. To isolate to the proper FRU, run Link Diags and perform the actions that it recommends. If no action is recommended, because Diags cannot isolate to the proper FRU, replace the FRUs in the order listed.

alert.description: alert: BOUNCINGLRLNK:Bouncing LR-Link
alert.msg_template: LR-link bouncing between frame $frame cage $cage (superNode $supernode drawer $drawer ) hub $hub port $remotePort and frame $neighbor_frame cage $neighbor_cage (superNode $neighbor_supernode drawer $neighbor_drawer) hub $neighbor_hub port $neighbor_remotePort (Bouncing LR-Link)
alert.recommendation: There is a problem with an LR-Link. Record the alert ID. Record the location in the alert message. Contact IBM Service. Log on to the Management Server. To isolate to the proper FRU, run Link Diags and perform the actions that it recommends. If no action is recommended, because Diags cannot isolate to the proper FRU, replace the FRUs in the order listed.
